thread.title: Prep sports: Wa-Hi swimmers shine at Lance Chance
thread.title_full: Prep sports: Wa-Hi swimmers shine at Lance Chance

title: Prep sports: Wa-Hi swimmers shine at Lance Chance
text: Print this article Advertisement Several Walla Walla High School swimmers set new personal records Saturday competing against Kamiakin, Kennewick and Pullman at the Last Chance Champs Invitational, the final meet of the regular season, in Harvey Pool at Whitman College. The meet also gave swimmers opportunities to record new qualifying times for the district championship meet to be held Oct. 29-20 in Moses Lake. Wa-Hi’s 200-meter medley relay team of Paige Gardner, Hannah Gardner, Mackenzie Hale and Hally Ruff started off the meet with a first-place finish at a minute and 59.48 seconds, two seconds faster than their previous season best. This time last season at the state championship meet, would have placed 18th. Paige Gardner also swam personal best times while stroking to first place in the 100 freestyle (56.06) and second place in the 100 backstroke (1:02.34). Both times would have qualified her for consolation finals (top 16) at state last year. Mackenzie Hale also posted a first- and a second-place finish in the 500 free (5:28.00) and the 200 individual medley respectively (2:18.90). Hale’s 200 IM time is her season best and would have qualified her for consolation finals (top 16) at last year’s state meet. Hannah Gardner won the 100 breast stroke (1:16.32) and was fourth in the 50 free with a new district qualifying time (28.32). Hally Ruff had solid performances today in the 50 free (26.26) and the 100 free (58.76), placing second and third respectively. Elena Holtkamp swam district qualifying times in both the 200 free (2:19.47) and the 100 free (1:04.21), finishing third and ninth respectively. Alana Budden dropped almost four seconds to secure a district spot in her third place 100 back (1:15.06) while also dropping time in the 50 free (29.55). Lacey Klem improved on her district qualifying time in the 50 free (28.52) with her fifth place finish. She also swam well in the 100 free (1:02.65) to finish in seventh place. TigerScots bounce back, top Irrigon IRRIGON — Weston-McEwen split a pair of Columbia Basin Conference volleyball matches here Saturday. The TigerScots opened the day with a 25-23, 25-8, 25-17 loss to second-ranked and CBC-leading Culver, but bounced back to topple Irrigon, 25-11, 25-20, 25-11. W-M, now 7-2 in league and 19-8 overall, clinched second place in the league with their Saturday triumph. Statistical leaders for the TigerScots were Ali Schroeder with 51 assists and six aces, Alyssa Finifrock with 18 kills and eight blocks, Maddi Muilenburg with three kills and three blocks, Anna Gilsdorf with 10 kills and five blocks, Sara von Borstel with 20 digs and eight kills, Sarah Finifrock with 20 kills, Mati Aby with 19 digs, Bailey Hillmick with six digs and four aces, and Tiah Benedict with eight digs. “It was a tough day for us,” W-M coach Shawn White said. “We started early and didn’t have the energy to play at Culver’s level. “We didn’t let down (vs. Irrigon),” White said. “We came out and took care of business. We kept playing consistent throughout. “We have to continue on improving to meet Culver’s level,” White said. Weston-McEwen ends the regular season Tuesday when it hosts league rival Stanfield. Prescott blanks Irrigon, 5-0 PRESCOTT — Prescott blanked Irrigon 5-0 here Friday in high school soccer action. The win improved the Tigers to 9-2 on the year. Manny Sanchez got the Tigers started in the 24th minute as he found the back of the net for a 1-0 Prescott lead. Jonathan Albarran found Ricardo Flores in the 32nd minute and Flores finished to up the lead to 2-0. Prescott made the lead stand up the rest of the way in the first half to go to intermission with that 2-0 lead. Three minutes into the second half, Sanchez put home his second unassisted goal of the game and Prescott was in control up 3-0. In the 61st minute, Flores punched home his own unassisted goal and Tyler Fedderson finished the Tiger scoring a minute later. Fedderson scored off a Jose Gonzalez assist to run the final to 5-0. Christian Caro, in goal for Prescott, picked up the shutout and posted three saves. Prescott plays at Walla Walla Valley Academy Monday. More like this story
